context: In models including traffic count, we also account for the distance between the home and the traffic count device located on the main avenue closest to the home. We also evaluated the potential modifying effect of asthma severity on the relationship between pollutant exposure and malondialdehyde levels. Association of malondialdehyde levels with health outcomes Generalized estimating equation models were used to study the association between malondialdehyde levels and pulmonary function (forced vital capacity [FVC] and FEV1) and IL-8 levels in nasal lavage. We also calculated the predicted FEV1 and FVC using the equation proposed by Peréz-Padilla et al 14 for Mexican children and calculated the association between malondialdehyde levels and changes in FEV1% and FVC%. IL-8 levels were not normally distributed and were log-transformed. Models were adjusted for sex, body mass index, and chronological time when studying lung function and for sex and chronological time only in models including IL-8 given that body mass index was not significantly related to IL-8 levels. Other potential confounding factors including atopy, age, and exposure to tobacco smoke were examined in preliminary analyses and did not modify the association.

The study investigates how MDA levels correlate with forced vital capacity (FVC) and FEV1 in relation to asthma severity and pollutant exposure. The analysis suggests that MDA levels may provide insights into respiratory health outcomes, particularly in children exposed to environmental pollutants.
